text: Marlow Webster Cook (July 27, 1926 - February 4, 2016) was an American politician. He was a member of the Republican Party. He served as the United States Senator from Kentucky from December 17, 1968 to December 27, 1974. He was born in Akron, New York. Cook died in Sarasota, Florida on February 4, 2016. He died from complications of a heart attack. He was aged 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:United States senators from Kentucky Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Marlow Cook
